Description: Timestamp of the first packet of the connection (Unix epoch float)
Populated When: Always — every Zeek connection gets a start timestamp
Behavioral Relevance: MEDIUM — useful for temporal splits and time-of-day features

Description: Zeek unique connection ID (random base62 string — e.g., CqO5kl1SJ3fdmkM94)
Populated When: Always — Zeek assigns a UID to every connection
Behavioral Relevance: NONE — just an internal key; not a behavioral feature

Description: Source IP address (originator host)
Behavioral Relevance: LOW for generalization — network-specific; causes topology overfitting

Description: Source port number (originator)
Behavioral Relevance: MEDIUM — ephemeral port patterns; low ports as source = suspicious

Description: Destination IP address (responder host)
Behavioral Relevance: LOW — same topology-overfitting risk as id.orig_h

Description: Destination port number (service being targeted)
Behavioral Relevance: HIGH — service identifier: 80=HTTP, 443=HTTPS, 22=SSH, 53=DNS, 8883=MQTT

Description: Transport layer protocol (tcp, udp, icmp, icmp6)
Behavioral Relevance: HIGH — different protocols = different attack vectors

Description: Application-layer service detected (http, dns, ssl, smtp, ssh, etc.)
Populated When: Zeek successfully identifies the application protocol
Empty/'-' When: '-' when service is unknown, encrypted without SNI, or not recognized
Behavioral Relevance: HIGH — '-' itself is informative (encrypted/evasive traffic)

Description: Total duration of the network connection in seconds
Populated When: Connection has defined start and end (Zeek saw both SYN and FIN/RST or timeout)
Empty/'-' When: '-' for single packets, ICMP, or flows terminated by capture end
Behavioral Relevance: VERY HIGH — short = scan/probe; long = data transfer, C2 keep-alive

Description: Payload bytes sent from originator (client) to responder (server)
Empty/'-' When: '-' for SYN-only probes, blocks, or RST without payload
Behavioral Relevance: VERY HIGH — exfiltration detection; 0/'-' = scan; large = data transfer

Description: Payload bytes sent from responder (server) to originator (client)
Behavioral Relevance: VERY HIGH — asymmetry ratio orig_bytes/resp_bytes reveals attack type

Description: Zeek TCP connection state code indicating handshake/teardown outcome
Protocol/Context: TCP primarily; abbreviated codes for UDP/ICMP
Populated When: Always — Zeek assigns a state to every connection
Behavioral Relevance: VERY HIGH — state codes (S0, REJ, RSTOS0, OTH) are attack signatures

Description: Boolean — whether the originator is local to the monitored network
Populated When: Zeek could determine locality from configured local subnets
Behavioral Relevance: MEDIUM — inbound vs. outbound distinction; IoT devices always local

Description: Boolean — whether the responder is local to the monitored network
Behavioral Relevance: MEDIUM — lateral movement detection (local→local vs. exfil local→external)

Description: Bytes Zeek missed due to packet loss or capture limitation
Behavioral Relevance: LOW behavioral — HIGH data quality signal; non-zero = unreliable row

Description: TCP flag history string (sequence of events: S=SYN, A=ACK, D=data, F=FIN, R=RST, …)
Empty/'-' When: '-' for UDP, ICMP, or no TCP activity logged
Behavioral Relevance: VERY HIGH — encodes entire handshake pattern; e.g., 'S' alone = SYN scan

Description: Number of packets sent by originator
Populated When: Always (at least 1 for any logged connection)
Behavioral Relevance: HIGH — packet flood detection; many pkts + 0 bytes = SYN scan

Description: Total IP-layer bytes from originator (payload + headers)
Behavioral Relevance: HIGH — includes overhead; useful for header-overhead fingerprinting

Description: Number of packets sent by responder
Empty/'-' When: 0 for unanswered flows; '-' for some protocols
Behavioral Relevance: HIGH — resp_pkts=0 = port close or firewall block

Description: Total IP-layer bytes from responder (payload + headers)
Behavioral Relevance: HIGH — resp_ip_bytes / orig_ip_bytes ratio detects amplification attacks

Description: Pattern-inferred: tunnel_parents   label   detailed-label — verify manually
Behavioral Relevance: N/A — target column

Description: Added by the loader — CTU-* folder name from which the row was loaded
Behavioral Relevance: NONE for model — useful for stratification and scenario-aware splits
